PatientMatching.TEXT:
Record date: 2078-07-30
Reason for Visit
Follow-up
Chief Complaint
L post-auricular pain
History of Present Illness
Developed mild pain in L ear and postauricular area the last two weeks. No trauma, no hearing loss, no vertigo, no URI symptoms
Problems
Hypertension
Tolerating Zestril without problems. BP still elevated on Zestril 20mg.
Obesity
She was started on Xenical by Internal Medicine. She is taking it only Qd instead of AC, since it is giving her too much loose stool. She feels increase flatulence, bloating sensation on Xenical.
Depression
Stable on Prozac. No adverse side effects. No SI or HI.
Knee pain
from medial meniscal tear. No edema, erythema. Celebrex effective initially but now not. She is taking on top of Celebrex also Motrin. She is going for return visit with Dr. Vogel to discuss surgery.
Anemia
Fe studies, vitamin B12, folate levels all normal. Asymptomatic without CP, SOB, or lightheadedness. No abnormal vaginal bleeding.
Medications
Zestril (LISINOPRIL) 20MG, 1 Tablet(s) PO QD
Prozac (FLUOXETINE Hcl) 20MG, 1 Tablet(s) PO QD
Xenical (ORLISTAT) 120MG, 1 Capsule(s) PO TID
IBUPROFEN 800MG, 1 Tablet(s) PO TID
Vaseretic 10-25 (ENALAPRIL 10mg + Hctz 25mg) .5 TABLET PO QD
Allergies
NKDA
Past Medical History
Reviewed electronic data
Reviewed old records
See problem list
Preventive Health History
See Health Maint.
Review of Systems
CONSTITUTIONAL: Appetite good, nutrition adequate
PAIN: see above
BREASTS: Inconsistent self-exam
RESP.: No cough
CVS: No PND, exertional chest pain, claudication.
GI: No dyspepsia, constipation
GU: No dysuria, diminished stream, incontinence
Vital Signs
BLOOD PRESSURE 160/70
PULSE 72
WEIGHT 196 lb
Physical Exam
Chest
clear to auscultation
Cor/Cardiac
RRR, unchanged 2/6 SEM at RUSB
Musc Skel
mild tenderness at medial joint line of L knee
HEENT
L TM clear with good light reflex; L ear canal without worrisome lesion; L auricle and post-auricular area without palpable tenderness or signs of infection, no postauricular lymphadenopathy
Assessment and Plan
Summary: 50yoF with obesity, knee pain, hypertension
1) hypertension: tolering Zestril. K and Cr are fine. Will increase Zestril to 40mg QD. Patient also given a prescription for Hctz 12.5mg QD but told not to start it yet until his next BP check and start only if BP > 140/85.
2) L knee pain: Celebrex not effective anymore. Patient told to stop and continue Ibuprofen 800mg TID with meals. Patient will see Dr. Vogel and discuss surgery. No benefit from PT.
3) obesity: taking only Xenical once a day. No significant weight change yet, but recently just started on Xenical. Will follow.
4) anemia: iron, vitamin B12, folate levels all normal. Not still menstruating. Rechecking Hct with reticulocyte count.
5) cardiac murmur: TTE in 8/78
6) L ear pain: etiology unclear. Will follow expectantly.
7) h/o GERD and Barrett's esophagitis: EGD in 8/78
8) hyperlipidemia: will recheck lipid panel at next visit and decide on statin therapy
Health Maintenance
- Breast exam/mammogram: 3/78 mammogram benign
- Pap smear: patient deferred to next visit
- Colonoscopy: will discuss at next visit
RTC: 1-2 months to f/u EGD and TTE results and recheck BP. Patient will likely need to start Hctz.
**************************************************************************************************** Record date: 2078-11-23
IVORY, LORI
2097545
11/22/78
PCP:Dr. Helen Updike
EDUCARE-PULLMAN TEAM A INTERN
ADMISSION NOTE
CC/ID: 51 yo F with no known h/o CHF or CAD, but with multiple cardiac risk factors, p/w dyspnea
HPI: Pt has had difficulty with bp ctrl due to poor med compliance (SBP 160-190 in clinic). Had been on Atenolol and Zestril but pt self-D/C'd Zestril several wks ago because she thought the Zestril made her feel nauseated. Since then, has had gradually developing DOE from baseline of walking over 4-5 flights of stairs without difficulty to dyspnea on only a flight of stairs. She underwent L knee arthroscopy for medial meniscal tear on 11/19/78 without immediate complications. At 3 am that night, though, woke up with severe dyspnea, with some relief upon sitting up. Associated with some wheezing; tried some of husband's nebs only slight relief. Later over the day, dyspnea worsened to the point that only few steps would make short of breath. Some association with non-radiating substernal chest tightness in evening; no N/V, lightheadness, diaphoresis, or pleuritic CP, F/S/C, or cough. Next day, dyspnea persisted so pt came into ED.
In ED, found to have BP of 230's/120's, satting 70's on RA. CTA PE-protocol showing no PE or DVT but with pulm edema and bibasilar atelectasis vs. PNA (unlikely). Given Lasix 40 mg IV x 1 2.7 L diuresis; started on nitropaste, Captopril, Labetalol BP down to 140's. Also given ASA and Lopressor x 1 and started on Heparin IV. Given Levoflox x 1 for ? PNA on CXR. Had to be on BiPAP for several hrs transitioned to 3L NC, satting mid-90's. Transferred to floor for further mgmt.
Has had recent 8/78 ECHO EF 67% with mild MR, TR, and AI; nl LV size and function without WMA.
ROS:
-Has had mild R subscapular dull pain on night before admission; not associated with her chest tightness or dyspnea; resolved on own on day of admission.
-Pt thinks L leg may be more swollen than her R
PMH
1. Hypertension
2. Obesity: followed by Internal Medicine
3. PUD: H.Pylori positive
4. s/p L knee meniscal repair
5. Depression
6. Anemia
7. Hypercholesterolemia
MEDS (AT HOME)
Atenolol 25 mg po qd
Zestril 40 mg po qd (has not been taking)
Prozac 20 mg po qd
Ibuprofen 800 mg po tid PRN pain
Percocet PRN pain post-surgery (has not been taking)
Allergies
NKDA
Social History
Quit smoking 10 yrs ago (2 ppd x 4-5 yrs_
5-6 beers/night on wkends; last drink last Sunday; no h/o withdrawal or seizures
Railway Transport Operations Supervisor at BI; lives with husband
Family History
-No known FH of CAD
-DM in father
PHYS EXAM
GEN: Comfortable, converses appropriately, A+O x 3
VS: T 98 HR 75 BP 152/92 (R arm, manual BP) 148/82 (L arm, manual BP) RR 22 96% on 2L
HEENT: NC/AT; PERRL, EOMI.
NECK: JVP 10 cm; no tracheal deviation. No carotid bruits.
CHEST: Crackles halfway up.
COR: No sternal heaves. Normal S1 and S2 with no loud P2. RRR, no M/R/G
ABD: Soft, NT, ND, BS+
Ext: 1+ pedal edema. No asymmetric leg edema or palpable cords. Warm, DP 2+ bilaterally and radial pulses 2+ bilaterally and symmetric
Neuro: Moving all ext's without impairment and in symmetric fashion. No decrease in fine-touch in all ext's.
DATA

-EKG (ED): NSR, ? STE in V1-2
-EKG (floor) 9 am: NSR with ? STE in V1-2
-EKG (floor) night: NSR with resolved STE in V1, still present in V2
CXR: pulm edema
A/P
51 yo F with no known CAD or CHF, p/w acute CHF in setting of severe HTN, c/b troponin leak
1.CARDS: Suspect that pt had flash pulm edema from HTN due to poor med compliance as well as from fluid re-mobilization post-surgery. Acute ischemic event possible given some EKG changes as well as mildly elevated troponin, but these findings could be also explained as demand ischemia event.
-Serial EKG's
-Cardiac monitor, telemetry
-Troponin elevation likely due to demand ischemia; subsequent level was lower, indicating resolving. Doubt ACS at this time but will continue to follow enz's
-ASA, Lopressor
-BP ctrl with ACE-I & B-blocker, aiming for SBP goal of 140's-160's for overnight (BP had been as high as 230's)
-Lipitor; Check fasting lipids & glucose, homocysteine
-Lasix as needed, aiming for TBB goal of neg 1-2 L; Strict I/O's, qd wt's
-ECHO and Adenosine-MIBI (when more stable)
2. Leg Edema: Doubt DVT, but given recent surgery and lack of mobility, will check LENI's
-Fragmin for DVT prophylaxis
-F/U LENI's
3. Miscellaneous:
Nexium
MVI, Folate, Thiamine
PT consult
Nutrition consult
4. Anemia
-Guaiac all stools; Bid Hct's for now
-Check iron studies, hemolysis labs, peripheral smear, retic count

51 yo F with hx of diastolc dysfunction and recent admission with flash pul edema in the setting of elevated BP, p/w similar symptoms, i.e. acute CHF in setting of severe HTN, no troponin leak, no new ischemic EKG changes
1.CARDS
-Serial EKG's
-Cardiac monitor, telemetry
- Serial Markers
-ASA, Lopressor
-BP ctrl with ACE-I & B-blocker, aiming for SBP goal of 140's-160's for overnight (BP had been as high as 220's)
-Lipitor; Check fasting lipids
-Lasix as needed; Strict I/O's, qd wt's
-No need for ECHO or Adenosine-MIBI on this admission given no new EKG changes
2. HTN:
- seems to be well controlled at this time
- if becomes difficult to control will titrate BB up and consider affing another agent
- may need to be worked up for 2/2 cause of HTN, such as RAS
3. Hx of med noncompliance:
- will need repetitive reinforcement re importance of adherence to medical regimen
- will discuss potential benefit from being plugged into the CHF clinic
- consider nutrition consult
4. Anemia
-Guaiac all stools;
- Resend iron studies, peripheral smear, retic count, folic acid, B12
- Consider transfusing idf HCT < 30
5. FEN: Low Sodium, Low Cholesterol, Low Fat Diet; Replete lytes as needed
6. Prophylaxis:
Nexium

PATIENT: Ivory, Lori MR: 2097545 ADMIT DATE: April 30, 2081 CODE STATUS: Full ATTENDING: Aviles/Meyers PCP: Kathryn Oakley/Gricelda Ovalle
CC: chest pain
HPI: 53 y/o female with PMHx significant for CHF/diastolic dysfunction, HTN who presents with 2 day history of chest pain. Pain started yesterday AM while she was getting into her car and lasted a few minutes. She had another episode later that day while trying to climb a step ladder in her kitchen and another episode in the ER today. Each episode went away after few minute (during 3rd episode she got some NTG with relief of pain). The pain feels like a pressure. She did have some diaphoresis with each episode and on the last episode also developed some nausea. Inspiration makes the pain worse as well as sitting upright. Denies palpitations. Does have SOB with pain. No recent illness. Did have URI few weeks ago. Her activity is limited by arthritis in her knee, but she denies any CP with activity.
ER: Got ASA, Metoprolol 5mg IV x3, PE protocol CT neg.
Problems Peptic ulcer disease : positive h pylori Hypertension Menopause Obesity Depression Knee pain Palpitations Heart murmur Hyperlipidemia Anemia Congestive heart failure, diastolic dysfunction, EF 67% in 78 Bright red blood per rectum
Medications Mvi (MULTIVITAMINS) 1 TAB PO QD Enteric COATED ASA 81 MG PO QD Percocet 1 TAB PO Q4H PRN pain Ibuprofen 600 MG PO Q6H PRN pain Zestril 40MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QD x 30 days Prozac 20 MG PO QD stopped taking this due to insurance issues Atenolol 50 MG PO QD Lasix 40MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QD
Allergies NKA
SOCIAL HISTORY The patient used to work as Railway Transport Operations Supervisor with Blyth Inc. Currently lives by herself. She quit smoking about ten years ago, eight to ten pack year smoking history prior to quitting. She drinks but has no history of alcohol withdrawal or seizures, says she drinks about five or six beers per. There is a previous use of cocaine in high school but no drug use currently.

Chest pain-concerning for ACS given symptoms. Does have HTN, HL, past smoking hx. **************************************************************************************************** Record date: 2082-02-21
Follow-up
Reports episode of N/V/D 3 weeks ago. Has had persistant RLQ pain that migrates somewhat x 3 weeks. No BRBPR or change in bowel habits. No vaginal bleeding. Appetite normal currently. no fevers/chills.
Problems Peptic ulcer disease : positive h pylori On prilosec w/good effect
Hypertension Recently we dropped back on Atenolol to 50 and d/c'ed HCTZ. BP a little elevated today at 140. Will need to reconsider regimen Lasix 40, Lisino 40, atenolol 50
Menopause stable, no vaginal bleeding
Obesity Has not tried any methods of weight loss recently. He appetite has increased lately and she attributes it to not drinking as much ETOH. Requests referral to weight center today. Faxed
Depression + ETOH dependence Still seeing therapy and psychpharm Symptoms improved from when I saw her last but has had a lot of deaths and illness in her family/friends recently. Finds that she is thinking about death (in these loved ones) but denies SI. She is taking Prozac 40 and Remeron 7.5
